snippet: Hurricane Arthur, the first hurricane of this season, made a surprising shift to the west as it neared North Carolina, and reports of damage were limited.
abstract: Residents of the Outer Banks in North Carolina are relieved that damage from Hurricane Arthur, which shifted course, was not greater; while area avoided catastrophe, many business owners are concerned about the dollars that slipped away during Fourth of July weekend.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Manteo, and John Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hurricane Arthur, the first hurricane of this season, made a surprising shift to the west as it neared North Carolina, and reports of damage were limited.

headline.main: Outer Banks Mops Up and Counts Storm’s Cost
headline.print_headline: Outer Banks Mops Up and Counts Storm’s Cost
